alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Typhoon Watch issued May 21 at 3:16AM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: ...CORRECT GRAMMER... ...TROPICAL DEPRESSION MAWAR (O2W) HAS STRENGTHENED TO TROPICAL STORM STATUS... .NEW INFORMATION... None. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides important information and recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas. .Watches/Warnings... A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for the following locations, Ulul and Polowat in western Chuuk State and Satawal in eastern Yap State. A Typhoon Watch continues for the following locations, Guam, Rota, Tinian, and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. .STORM INFORMATION... At 2 AM ChST...the center of Tropical Storm Mawar (02W) was located near latitude 5.9N...longitude 149.2E. This was about 525 miles south-southeast of Guam. Storm Motion was north-northwest. Storm Intensity was 40 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... When making decisions...do not focus on the exact forecast track. TD 02W has strengthened to tropical storm strength over western Chuuk State and is moving slowly north-northwest. It is too early to provide exact wind and surge forecast values for specific locations in the Marianas. A general concern should be for the possibility of at least extensive damage somewhere within Mariana Islands. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan around 9 AM...or sooner if conditions warrant. ...TYPHOON WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT... ...New Information... Tropical Depression Mawar (02W) has strengthened to tropical storm status. ...PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... ...Probability of tropical storm/typhoon conditions... The onset of tropical storm conditions could start as early as Monday afternoon, but are more likely Tuesday morning. ...Winds... As Tropical Storm Mawar moves closer, the threat for sustained high winds is likely to increase. The latest forecast is for tropical storm force winds from Tuesday morning to late Wednesday evening. Tropical storm force winds are currently forecast to begin affecting the area early Tuesday evening. Strong Tropical Storm or Typhoon force winds are possible late Tuesday evening through Wednesday night. A general concern should be for the possibility of at least damaging winds somewhere within the area. ...Storm surge and storm tide... Dangerous surf conditions are possible Monday evening through at least Thursday. ...Inland flooding... Heavy rainfall is likely through most of the week. Rainfall amounts of 9 to 15 inches are possible with locally heavier amounts. Monitor conditions for possible flood watches, advisories or warnings.
info.instruction: For those under a warning, preparations according to your typhoon disaster plan should be well under way or complete. Remain in shelter until the all clear is given by your local emergency management authority. For those under a watch, now is the time to begin preparing your home or business according to your typhoon disaster plan. Listen for possible warnings and be ready to evacuate if necessary. Heed the advice of local officials and comply with any orders that are issued. For interests at ports, docks and marinas, it is recommended that you perform the prescribed preparations according to your emergency operations plan for tropical cyclones. If you live on a boat, begin to safely secure your craft and make plans to leave it for adequate land-based shelter. Listen for possible warnings. Regarding the coastal waters under a watch, small craft should return to port or seek safe harbor. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast. For additional precautionary and preparedness information, please refer to the detailed recommendations relative to your location as further described by your local National Weather Service office and your local emergency management.
